Zerg](#Vs._Zerg) * [5 Gallery](#Gallery) * [6 Quotes](#Quotes) * [7 Patch Changes](#Patch_Changes) * [8 External Links](#External_Links) * [9 References](#References) Close top ad Disruptor ========= From Liquipedia StarCraft 2 Wiki \[[e](https://liquipedia.net/starcraft2/index.php?title=Disruptor&action=edit§ion=0)\ \]\[[h](/starcraft2/Template:Infobox_unit "Template:Infobox unit")\ \]![Protoss](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/0/0f/Protoss_race_icon.png/30px-Protoss_race_icon.png%20%22Protoss%22) Disruptor [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/c/c7/SC2Disruptor.jpg/600px-SC2Disruptor.jpg)](/starcraft2/File:SC2Disruptor.jpg) [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/c/c7/SC2Disruptor.jpg/600px-SC2Disruptor.jpg)](/starcraft2/File:SC2Disruptor.jpg) Unit Information Type: Ground Unit Description: The disruptor is a light-mechanical unit. Built From: [Robotics Facility](/starcraft2/Robotics_Facility_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Robotics Facility (Legacy of the Void)") Requirements: * [Robotics Bay](/starcraft2/Robotics_Bay "Robotics Bay") Cost: [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/a/a4/Minerals.gif)](/starcraft2/Minerals "Minerals")  150 [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/2/2e/Vespene-protoss.gif)](/starcraft2/Gas "Gas")  150 [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/a/a4/Buildtime_protoss.gif)](/starcraft2/Game_Speed "Game Speed")  36 [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/8/86/Supply-protoss.gif)](/starcraft2/Supply "Supply")  4 [Hotkey](/starcraft2/Hotkeys_per_Race "Hotkeys per Race") : D Unit stats Defense: ![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/e/e2/Icon_Hitpoints.png) 100 [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/8/82/Icon_Shields.png)](/starcraft2/Plasma_Shield "Plasma Shield") 100 [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/5/5e/Icon_Armor.png)](/starcraft2/Armor "Armor") 1 (+1) Attributes: [Armored](/starcraft2/Armored "Armored") , [Mechanical](/starcraft2/Mechanical "Mechanical") Sight: 9 Speed: 3.15 Cargo size: 4 Strong against: * [Marauder](/starcraft2/Marauder_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Marauder (Legacy of the Void)") * [Hydralisk](/starcraft2/Hydralisk_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Hydralisk (Legacy of the Void)") * [Stalker](/starcraft2/Stalker_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Stalker (Legacy of the Void)") Weak against: * [Thor](/starcraft2/Thor_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Thor (Legacy of the Void)") * [Ultralisk](/starcraft2/Ultralisk_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Ultralisk (Legacy of the Void)") * [Tempest](/starcraft2/Tempest_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Tempest (Legacy of the Void)") Contents -------- * [1 Description](#Description) * [2 Abilities](#Abilities) * [3 Upgrades](#Upgrades) * [4 Competitive Usage](#Competitive_Usage) * [4.1 General](#General) * [4.2 Vs. Protoss](#Vs._Protoss) * [4.3 Vs. Terran](#Vs._Terran) * [4.4 Vs. Zerg](#Vs._Zerg) * [5 Gallery](#Gallery) * [6 Quotes](#Quotes) * [7 Patch Changes](#Patch_Changes) * [8 External Links](#External_Links) * [9 References](#References) Description\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Disruptor&action=edit§ion=1 "Edit section: Description")\ \] --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The **Disruptor** is a [Protoss](/starcraft2/Protoss "Protoss") Construct unit with no auto attack, produced from the [Robotics Facility](/starcraft2/Robotics_Facility "Robotics Facility") after finishing the [Robotics Bay](/starcraft2/Robotics_Bay "Robotics Bay") . It was introduced in [Legacy of the Void](/starcraft2/Legacy_of_the_Void "Legacy of the Void") . Originally built for channeling power from a starship reactor, this unit's design and animation while using its ability reflect this. Once enabled, its "Purification Nova" (Nova for short), after a short delay for targeting, explodes and hits friendly and enemy units alike (except friendly Disruptors). The movement speed of the Nova is slightly faster than the average speed of units without their movement upgrades, with other units can dodge or escape into the air. Similar to the [High Templar](/starcraft2/High_Templar "High Templar") and its [Psionic Storm](/starcraft2/Psionic_Storm "Psionic Storm") ability this unit is best used with a [Warp Prism](/starcraft2/Warp_Prism "Warp Prism") (ideally with [Gravitic Drive](/starcraft2/Gravitic_Drive "Gravitic Drive") ), which can carry two. Abilities\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Disruptor&action=edit§ion=2 "Edit section: Abilities")\ \] ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- [Purification Nova](/starcraft2/Purification_Nova "Purification Nova") | | | | --- | --- | | [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/6/6d/Purification_Nova.png)](/starcraft2/File:Purification_Nova.png) | **Caster:** Disruptor

**[Cooldown](/starcraft2/Cooldown "Cooldown")
:** 21.4 s

**[Duration](/starcraft2/Game_Speed "Game Speed")
:** 2.1 s

**Radius:** 1.375

**[Hotkey](/starcraft2/Hotkeys_per_Race "Hotkeys per Race")
:** V

Shoots out a ball of energy that detonates after 2.1 seconds, dealing 145 splash damage and an additional 55 shield damage to nearby ground units and structures. The Disruptor is immobile while this is active. The Disruptor's visual glow is dulled a little bit during cool-down. | This ability damages friendly units, except other Disruptors. The nova moves at a speed of 5.95. It can be countered with skilled micromanagement. It is best used against relatively weak units such as workers. The Disruptors Purification Nova can kill [Marines](/starcraft2/Marine "Marine") , [Marauders](/starcraft2/Marauder "Marauder") , [Ghosts](/starcraft2/Ghost "Ghost") , [Hellions](/starcraft2/Hellion "Hellion") , [Hellbats](/starcraft2/Hellbat "Hellbat") , [Reapers](/starcraft2/Reaper "Reaper") , [Widow Mines](/starcraft2/Widow_Mine "Widow Mine") , [Cyclones](/starcraft2/Cyclone "Cyclone") , [Vikings](/starcraft2/Viking "Viking") in Assault mode, [Zerglings](/starcraft2/Zergling "Zergling") , [Banelings](/starcraft2/Baneling "Baneling") , [Hydralisks](/starcraft2/Hydralisk "Hydralisk") , [Roaches](/starcraft2/Roach "Roach") , [Ravagers](/starcraft2/Ravager "Ravager") , [Infestors](/starcraft2/Infestor "Infestor") , [Zealots](/starcraft2/Zealot "Zealot") , [Stalkers](/starcraft2/Stalker "Stalker") , [High Templars](/starcraft2/High_Templar "High Templar") , [Dark Templars](/starcraft2/Dark_Templar "Dark Templar") , [Adepts](/starcraft2/Adept "Adept") , Disruptors, and [Sentrys](/starcraft2/Sentry "Sentry") with one shot. To kill [Siege Tanks](/starcraft2/Siege_Tank "Siege Tank") , [Queens](/starcraft2/Queen "Queen") , [Swarm Hosts](/starcraft2/Swarm_Host "Swarm Host") , [Archons](/starcraft2/Archon "Archon") , or [Lurkers](/starcraft2/Lurker "Lurker") two Novas are needed. Two Novas are needed to kill an [Immortal](/starcraft2/Immortal "Immortal") but only if you wait out the [Immortal](/starcraft2/Immortal "Immortal") 's barrier between the first and second shot. It needs three or more Novas to take out [Ultralisks](/starcraft2/Ultralisk "Ultralisk") , [Colossi](/starcraft2/Collosus "Collosus") , and [Thors](/starcraft2/Thor "Thor") . Upgrades\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Disruptor&action=edit§ion=3 "Edit section: Upgrades")\ \] --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Competitive Usage\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Disruptor&action=edit§ion=4 "Edit section: Competitive Usage")\ \] --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ### General\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Disruptor&action=edit§ion=5 "Edit section: General")\ \] * The Disruptor fills a similar role to the [Colossus](/starcraft2/Colossus "Colossus") , but is not specialized against light units. However, Purification Nova will still one-shot any light ground unit. Colossi are capable of moving across cliffs and combo well with the [Stalker](/starcraft2/Stalker "Stalker") 's [Blink](/starcraft2/Blink "Blink") ability for short range instant teleportation; however Colossi can be hit from the air and have a limited window of time to be useful and alive. * Disruptors can be a follow-up to Colossi or a cheaper alternative, especially if opening [Warp Prism](/starcraft2/Warp_Prism "Warp Prism") with [Gravitic Drive](/starcraft2/Gravitic_Drive "Gravitic Drive") for drop harassment. * The Disruptor is very good when paired with the [Mothership](/starcraft2/Mothership_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Mothership (Legacy of the Void)") 's time warp ability, preventing the enemy army from effectively retreating or splitting their army. * Combinations with the [Sentry](/starcraft2/Sentry_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Sentry (Legacy of the Void)") 's force field can prevent enemy units from escaping the Purification Nova as well. Additionally, the Purification Nova can go through [Force Fields](/starcraft2/Force_Field "Force Field") . * The Disruptor is very good against ground units that cannot move, such as [Siege Tanks](/starcraft2/Siege_Tanks "Siege Tanks") in siege mode and [Lurkers](/starcraft2/Lurkers "Lurkers") , or even enemy Disruptors. * Disruptors also allow one to kill stealth units without detection. ### Vs.[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/e/e4/ProtossIcon.png/30px-ProtossIcon.png)](/starcraft2/File:ProtossIcon.png) Protoss\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Disruptor&action=edit§ion=6 "Edit section: Vs. Protoss")\ \] * [Immortals](/starcraft2/Immortal "Immortal") are sometimes used to handle Disruptors numbers. * [Stalkers](/starcraft2/Stalker_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Stalker (Legacy of the Void)") can use Blink to avoid damage from the Nova. * [Phoenix](/starcraft2/Phoenix "Phoenix") are often used to disable Disruptors once the Nova has been launched, which prevents all damage. ### Vs.[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/9/94/TerranIcon.png/30px-TerranIcon.png)](/starcraft2/File:TerranIcon.png) Terran\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Disruptor&action=edit§ion=7 "Edit section: Vs. Terran")\ \] * Used as an opening with [Warp Prism](/starcraft2/Warp_Prism "Warp Prism") (with Speed Upgraded). * They can combat [Siege Tank](/starcraft2/Siege_Tank "Siege Tank") pushes and other mech units. Their nova range is equivalent to siege range, and lets them hit tanks without taking any damage if microed perfectly. * However, they must be supported with gateway units, as the tank will be left with 30 HP after being hit by the nova, and the disruptor will die to a third shot from the sieged tank. * As a follow-up after Colossi which have been hard countered by [Vikings](/starcraft2/Viking "Viking") . Disruptors can provide AOE support without being vulnerable to anti-air. * Disruptors are also a more effective response to deal with large masses of [Marauders](/starcraft2/Marauder "Marauder") (as the unit has the armored tag, and does not take anti-light bonus damage from the Colossus). ### Vs.[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/d/d1/ZergIcon.png/30px-ZergIcon.png)](/starcraft2/File:ZergIcon.png) Zerg\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Disruptor&action=edit§ion=8 "Edit section: Vs. Zerg")\ \] With the revertion of the Disruptor to its pre 4.0 state Disruptors are no longer as useless vs Zerg as they have been during patch 4.0 - 4.7.1 With this said, it is only advisable when a Zerg creates force of [Roaches](/starcraft2/Roach_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Roach (Legacy of the Void)") and [Hydralisks](/starcraft2/Hydralisk_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Hydralisk (Legacy of the Void)") or Roaches and [Ravagers](/starcraft2/Ravagers "Ravagers") trying to brute force their way through a Protoss while off creep in large clumps is very vulnerable to getting destroyed by Purification Novas. Gallery\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Disruptor&action=edit§ion=9 "Edit section: Gallery")\ \] ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- * [![2015-04-12 Disruptor-invincible.jpg](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/b/b9/2015-04-12_Disruptor-invincible.jpg/160px-2015-04-12_Disruptor-invincible.jpg)](/starcraft2/File:2015-04-12_Disruptor-invincible.jpg) * [![2015-04-12 Disruptor-vs-Marines.jpg](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/a/a0/2015-04-12_Disruptor-vs-Marines.jpg/161px-2015-04-12_Disruptor-vs-Marines.jpg)](/starcraft2/File:2015-04-12_Disruptor-vs-Marines.jpg) * [![2015-04-12 Disruptor-explode.jpg](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/d/da/2015-04-12_Disruptor-explode.jpg/160px-2015-04-12_Disruptor-explode.jpg)](/starcraft2/File:2015-04-12_Disruptor-explode.jpg) * [![2015-04-10 2Disruptor.jpg](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/d/d3/2015-04-10_2Disruptor.jpg/160px-2015-04-10_2Disruptor.jpg)](/starcraft2/File:2015-04-10_2Disruptor.jpg) * [![2015-04-10 1Disruptor killing Hydras Blink.jpg](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/5/51/2015-04-10_1Disruptor_killing_Hydras_Blink.jpg/161px-2015-04-10_1Disruptor_killing_Hydras_Blink.jpg)](/starcraft2/File:2015-04-10_1Disruptor_killing_Hydras_Blink.jpg) Quotes\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Disruptor&action=edit§ion=10 "Edit section: Quotes")\ \] ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | \[[hide](#)

\]\[[show](#)
\]Patch 2.5.5 Balance Update #4[\[6\]](#) | | --- | | * Disruptors can now be loaded into Warp Prisms while Purification Nova is active.
* This action will cancel Purification Nova, causing no damage. | | \[[hide](#)
\]\[[show](#)
\]Patch 4.0.0 [\[7\]](#) | | --- | | * Purification Nova will detonate when in contact with an enemy unit.
* Damage remains at 145 (+55 shields).
* Damage radius remains at 1.5
* Detonation radius is 0.25.
* Will not trigger on enemy structures or changelings.
* Purification Nova cooldown reduced from 21.4 to 14.3 seconds. | | \[[hide](#)
\]\[[show](#)
\]Patch 4.1.1 Balance Update[\[8\]](#) | | --- | | * Purification Nova has a 1 second charge-up time before launch. | | \[[hide](#)
\]\[[show](#)
\]Patch 4.1.4 Balance Update [\[9\]](#) | | --- | | * Purification Nova’s initial pause duration reduced from 1 second to 0 seconds.
* When Disruptors drop from transports, if Purification Nova is not on cooldown, then there will be a 0.7 second pause before being able to use Purification Nova.
* Range indicators will be displayed for Purification Nova when the Disruptor is selected. | | \[[hide](#)
\]\[[show](#)
\]Patch 4.7.1 [\[10\]](#) | | --- | | * Purification Nova changed back to pre-4.0 state. Purification Nova deploys a ball of energy that will detonate after 2 seconds, dealing 145 damage and an additional 55 shield damage to all ground units in its radius.
* Purification Nova no longer detonates on contact with enemy units.
* Purification Nova now sends a threat signal to the opponent on detonation instead of during the launch phase. | | \[[hide](#)
\]\[[show](#)
\]Patch 5.0.11 [\[11\]](#) | | --- | | * Purification Nova's radius reduced from 1.5 to 1.375. | | \[[hide](#)
\]\[[show](#)
\]Patch 5.0.12 [\[12\]](#) | | --- | | * Supply cost increased from 3 to 4.
* Model scale reduced by 9%.
* Radius increased from 0.5 to 0.625 (does not affect collision with buildings). | External Links\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Disruptor&action=edit§ion=12 "Edit section: External Links")\ \] ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- References\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Disruptor&action=edit§ion=13 "Edit section: References")\ \] -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 1. Zerg](#Vs._Zerg) * [5 Gallery](#Gallery) * [6 Quotes](#Quotes) * [7 Patch Changes](#Patch_Changes) * [8 External Links](#External_Links) * [9 References](#References) Close top ad Disruptor ========= From Liquipedia StarCraft 2 Wiki \[[e](https://liquipedia.net/starcraft2/index.php?title=Disruptor&action=edit§ion=0)\ \]\[[h](/starcraft2/Template:Infobox_unit "Template:Infobox unit")\ \]![Protoss](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/0/0f/Protoss_race_icon.png/30px-Protoss_race_icon.png%20%22Protoss%22) Disruptor [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/c/c7/SC2Disruptor.jpg/600px-SC2Disruptor.jpg)](/starcraft2/File:SC2Disruptor.jpg) [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/c/c7/SC2Disruptor.jpg/600px-SC2Disruptor.jpg)](/starcraft2/File:SC2Disruptor.jpg) Unit Information Type: Ground Unit Description: The disruptor is a light-mechanical unit. Built From: [Robotics Facility](/starcraft2/Robotics_Facility_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Robotics Facility (Legacy of the Void)") Requirements: * [Robotics Bay](/starcraft2/Robotics_Bay "Robotics Bay") Cost: [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/a/a4/Minerals.gif)](/starcraft2/Minerals "Minerals")  150 [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/2/2e/Vespene-protoss.gif)](/starcraft2/Gas "Gas")  150 [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/a/a4/Buildtime_protoss.gif)](/starcraft2/Game_Speed "Game Speed")  36 [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/8/86/Supply-protoss.gif)](/starcraft2/Supply "Supply")  4 [Hotkey](/starcraft2/Hotkeys_per_Race "Hotkeys per Race") : D Unit stats Defense: ![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/e/e2/Icon_Hitpoints.png) 100 [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/8/82/Icon_Shields.png)](/starcraft2/Plasma_Shield "Plasma Shield") 100 [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/5/5e/Icon_Armor.png)](/starcraft2/Armor "Armor") 1 (+1) Attributes: [Armored](/starcraft2/Armored "Armored") , [Mechanical](/starcraft2/Mechanical "Mechanical") Sight: 9 Speed: 3.15 Cargo size: 4 Strong against: * [Marauder](/starcraft2/Marauder_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Marauder (Legacy of the Void)") * [Hydralisk](/starcraft2/Hydralisk_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Hydralisk (Legacy of the Void)") * [Stalker](/starcraft2/Stalker_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Stalker (Legacy of the Void)") Weak against: * [Thor](/starcraft2/Thor_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Thor (Legacy of the Void)") * [Ultralisk](/starcraft2/Ultralisk_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Ultralisk (Legacy of the Void)") * [Tempest](/starcraft2/Tempest_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Tempest (Legacy of the Void)") Contents -------- * [1 Description](#Description) * [2 Abilities](#Abilities) * [3 Upgrades](#Upgrades) * [4 Competitive Usage](#Competitive_Usage) * [4.1 General](#General) * [4.2 Vs. Protoss](#Vs._Protoss) * [4.3 Vs. Terran](#Vs._Terran) * [4.4 Vs. Zerg](#Vs._Zerg) * [5 Gallery](#Gallery) * [6 Quotes](#Quotes) * [7 Patch Changes](#Patch_Changes) * [8 External Links](#External_Links) * [9 References](#References) Description\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Disruptor&action=edit§ion=1 "Edit section: Description")\ \] --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The **Disruptor** is a [Protoss](/starcraft2/Protoss "Protoss") Construct unit with no auto attack, produced from the [Robotics Facility](/starcraft2/Robotics_Facility "Robotics Facility") after finishing the [Robotics Bay](/starcraft2/Robotics_Bay "Robotics Bay") . It was introduced in [Legacy of the Void](/starcraft2/Legacy_of_the_Void "Legacy of the Void") . Originally built for channeling power from a starship reactor, this unit's design and animation while using its ability reflect this. Once enabled, its "Purification Nova" (Nova for short), after a short delay for targeting, explodes and hits friendly and enemy units alike (except friendly Disruptors). The movement speed of the Nova is slightly faster than the average speed of units without their movement upgrades, with other units can dodge or escape into the air. Similar to the [High Templar](/starcraft2/High_Templar "High Templar") and its [Psionic Storm](/starcraft2/Psionic_Storm "Psionic Storm") ability this unit is best used with a [Warp Prism](/starcraft2/Warp_Prism "Warp Prism") (ideally with [Gravitic Drive](/starcraft2/Gravitic_Drive "Gravitic Drive") ), which can carry two. Abilities\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Disruptor&action=edit§ion=2 "Edit section: Abilities")\ \] ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- [Purification Nova](/starcraft2/Purification_Nova "Purification Nova") | | | | --- | --- | | [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/6/6d/Purification_Nova.png)](/starcraft2/File:Purification_Nova.png) | **Caster:** Disruptor

**[Cooldown](/starcraft2/Cooldown "Cooldown")
:** 21.4 s

**[Duration](/starcraft2/Game_Speed "Game Speed")
:** 2.1 s

**Radius:** 1.375

**[Hotkey](/starcraft2/Hotkeys_per_Race "Hotkeys per Race")
:** V

Shoots out a ball of energy that detonates after 2.1 seconds, dealing 145 splash damage and an additional 55 shield damage to nearby ground units and structures. The Disruptor is immobile while this is active. The Disruptor's visual glow is dulled a little bit during cool-down. | This ability damages friendly units, except other Disruptors. The nova moves at a speed of 5.95. It can be countered with skilled micromanagement. It is best used against relatively weak units such as workers. The Disruptors Purification Nova can kill [Marines](/starcraft2/Marine "Marine") , [Marauders](/starcraft2/Marauder "Marauder") , [Ghosts](/starcraft2/Ghost "Ghost") , [Hellions](/starcraft2/Hellion "Hellion") , [Hellbats](/starcraft2/Hellbat "Hellbat") , [Reapers](/starcraft2/Reaper "Reaper") , [Widow Mines](/starcraft2/Widow_Mine "Widow Mine") , [Cyclones](/starcraft2/Cyclone "Cyclone") , [Vikings](/starcraft2/Viking "Viking") in Assault mode, [Zerglings](/starcraft2/Zergling "Zergling") , [Banelings](/starcraft2/Baneling "Baneling") , [Hydralisks](/starcraft2/Hydralisk "Hydralisk") , [Roaches](/starcraft2/Roach "Roach") , [Ravagers](/starcraft2/Ravager "Ravager") , [Infestors](/starcraft2/Infestor "Infestor") , [Zealots](/starcraft2/Zealot "Zealot") , [Stalkers](/starcraft2/Stalker "Stalker") , [High Templars](/starcraft2/High_Templar "High Templar") , [Dark Templars](/starcraft2/Dark_Templar "Dark Templar") , [Adepts](/starcraft2/Adept "Adept") , Disruptors, and [Sentrys](/starcraft2/Sentry "Sentry") with one shot. To kill [Siege Tanks](/starcraft2/Siege_Tank "Siege Tank") , [Queens](/starcraft2/Queen "Queen") , [Swarm Hosts](/starcraft2/Swarm_Host "Swarm Host") , [Archons](/starcraft2/Archon "Archon") , or [Lurkers](/starcraft2/Lurker "Lurker") two Novas are needed. Two Novas are needed to kill an [Immortal](/starcraft2/Immortal "Immortal") but only if you wait out the [Immortal](/starcraft2/Immortal "Immortal") 's barrier between the first and second shot. It needs three or more Novas to take out [Ultralisks](/starcraft2/Ultralisk "Ultralisk") , [Colossi](/starcraft2/Collosus "Collosus") , and [Thors](/starcraft2/Thor "Thor") . Upgrades\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Disruptor&action=edit§ion=3 "Edit section: Upgrades")\ \] --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Competitive Usage\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Disruptor&action=edit§ion=4 "Edit section: Competitive Usage")\ \] --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ### General\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Disruptor&action=edit§ion=5 "Edit section: General")\ \] * The Disruptor fills a similar role to the [Colossus](/starcraft2/Colossus "Colossus") , but is not specialized against light units. However, Purification Nova will still one-shot any light ground unit. Colossi are capable of moving across cliffs and combo well with the [Stalker](/starcraft2/Stalker "Stalker") 's [Blink](/starcraft2/Blink "Blink") ability for short range instant teleportation; however Colossi can be hit from the air and have a limited window of time to be useful and alive. * Disruptors can be a follow-up to Colossi or a cheaper alternative, especially if opening [Warp Prism](/starcraft2/Warp_Prism "Warp Prism") with [Gravitic Drive](/starcraft2/Gravitic_Drive "Gravitic Drive") for drop harassment. * The Disruptor is very good when paired with the [Mothership](/starcraft2/Mothership_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Mothership (Legacy of the Void)") 's time warp ability, preventing the enemy army from effectively retreating or splitting their army. * Combinations with the [Sentry](/starcraft2/Sentry_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Sentry (Legacy of the Void)") 's force field can prevent enemy units from escaping the Purification Nova as well. Additionally, the Purification Nova can go through [Force Fields](/starcraft2/Force_Field "Force Field") . * The Disruptor is very good against ground units that cannot move, such as [Siege Tanks](/starcraft2/Siege_Tanks "Siege Tanks") in siege mode and [Lurkers](/starcraft2/Lurkers "Lurkers") , or even enemy Disruptors. * Disruptors also allow one to kill stealth units without detection. ### Vs.[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/e/e4/ProtossIcon.png/30px-ProtossIcon.png)](/starcraft2/File:ProtossIcon.png) Protoss\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Disruptor&action=edit§ion=6 "Edit section: Vs. Protoss")\ \] * [Immortals](/starcraft2/Immortal "Immortal") are sometimes used to handle Disruptors numbers. * [Stalkers](/starcraft2/Stalker_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Stalker (Legacy of the Void)") can use Blink to avoid damage from the Nova. * [Phoenix](/starcraft2/Phoenix "Phoenix") are often used to disable Disruptors once the Nova has been launched, which prevents all damage. ### Vs.[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/9/94/TerranIcon.png/30px-TerranIcon.png)](/starcraft2/File:TerranIcon.png) Terran\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Disruptor&action=edit§ion=7 "Edit section: Vs. Terran")\ \] * Used as an opening with [Warp Prism](/starcraft2/Warp_Prism "Warp Prism") (with Speed Upgraded). * They can combat [Siege Tank](/starcraft2/Siege_Tank "Siege Tank") pushes and other mech units. Their nova range is equivalent to siege range, and lets them hit tanks without taking any damage if microed perfectly. * However, they must be supported with gateway units, as the tank will be left with 30 HP after being hit by the nova, and the disruptor will die to a third shot from the sieged tank. * As a follow-up after Colossi which have been hard countered by [Vikings](/starcraft2/Viking "Viking") . Disruptors can provide AOE support without being vulnerable to anti-air. * Disruptors are also a more effective response to deal with large masses of [Marauders](/starcraft2/Marauder "Marauder") (as the unit has the armored tag, and does not take anti-light bonus damage from the Colossus). ### Vs.[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/d/d1/ZergIcon.png/30px-ZergIcon.png)](/starcraft2/File:ZergIcon.png) Zerg\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Disruptor&action=edit§ion=8 "Edit section: Vs. Zerg")\ \] With the revertion of the Disruptor to its pre 4.0 state Disruptors are no longer as useless vs Zerg as they have been during patch 4.0 - 4.7.1 With this said, it is only advisable when a Zerg creates force of [Roaches](/starcraft2/Roach_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Roach (Legacy of the Void)") and [Hydralisks](/starcraft2/Hydralisk_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Hydralisk (Legacy of the Void)") or Roaches and [Ravagers](/starcraft2/Ravagers "Ravagers") trying to brute force their way through a Protoss while off creep in large clumps is very vulnerable to getting destroyed by Purification Novas.
